text: I enjoy building or fixing things with my hands (like gadgets, models, or DIY projects).
I like following clear rules and procedures to finish a task (e.g., lab steps, recipes).
I enjoy solving puzzles and researching to find answers (like science or detective work).
I like helping people and working together to solve their problems.
I enjoy creating things that look or feel beautiful — drawing, music, design, or making videos.
I enjoy leading group projects, persuading people, or starting a small business idea.
I prefer tasks that are routine and predictable rather than changing all the time.
I like working outdoors or with physical objects (gardening, sports coaching, craftwork).
I enjoy understanding how things work: maps, charts, experiments, or coding logic.
I enjoy storytelling, acting, or working on presentations and media projects.
I like organizing work, making checklists, and ensuring deadlines are met.
I get energy from teaching others, volunteering, or helping friends solve problems.
I like taking calculated risks to try new things, such as launching small ventures or competitions.
I prefer activities where I can experiment, analyze results, and test my ideas.
In 2–3 sentences, tell us one project or activity you enjoyed the most and why.
